item.description:
Please join Boston Volunteers and members of the Braintree Area Community as we gather for Habitat for Humanity's Braintree Area Local Partnership Committee (LPC) Monthly Community Meeting!  We have built 4 homes in Braintree and have organized a Local Partnership Committee (LPC) in anticipation of another Braintree or local build in the Braintree area (which includes Holbrook, Quincy, Randolph and Weymouth).  The BALPC meets the 2nd Wednesday of the month @ 7-8:30pm @ 74 Pond Street, Braintree.

Our new LPC Chair, Sandy, is ready to ramp up the charge as we continue our land search.  We have several fundraising initiatives underway and are seeking a Secretary, Treasurer, Outreach Coordinator, and Fundraising Coordinator for our LPC.

We will spend some time at tonight's Community Meeting discussing various aspects of the LPC, including but not limited to Fundraising, Outreach, Faith Relations, Land/Site Search and more.  Please join us to meet your Leadership Team, Committee Members and Neighbors at our monthly Community Meeting!

This is an exciting opportunity for those who want some hands-on experience with Habitat for Humanity, even if not actually lifting a hammer to physically build a home for a family. (Although being an active member of the LPC gives you a greater chance of being able to swing a hammer if you want to do so.)  The Local Partnership Committee (LPC) participates in lots of behind the scenes activities and brings the community together. This is a great way to utilize your skills, meet neighbors, develop friendships, and help spread the word about Habitat for Humanity as we work together to bring a local family into homeownership.

Please join us as we learn more about Habitat for Humanity and each other.

Please RSVP Yes only if you are at least 98% sure you will be attending.  If you are unable to attend but want to learn more and/or be added to the email list please email your contact information (name, email, town) to the email address listed below.  Please be advised there is no need to RSVP No if you are unable to attend.


The Boston Volunteers: Big enough to Deliver, small enough to care

Learn more: www.BostonVolunteer.org

Follow us: @BostonVolunteer

http://www.facebook.com/BostonVolunteers

or Do you have Twitter?

https://twitter.com/#!/BostonVolunteer

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Habitat for Humanity Braintree Area LPC Community Meeting!

2nd Wednesday of the Month @ 7pm-8:30pm

2013 Meeting Dates: April 10th, May 8th, June 12th, July 10th, August 14th, September 11th, October 9th, November 13th and December 11th

Braintree Community Youth Center

74 Pond Street, 2nd Floor

Braintree, MA 02184

W: www.sshabitat.org

E: BraintreeLPC@sshabitat.org (Join the email list by sending us your name, town, email and if desired your phone # to this email address.)

Meeting Location: BCYC, located on the 2nd floor

Event Host(s)/Organizer(s): Phoebe (LPC Volunteer Coordinator) and Angela (LPC Outreach Coordinator)

Min/Max: All are welcome!  Since the room capacity is 60 people we will set the maximum for this group at 20 people.  The WL is set to automatic which means as someone changes from Yes to No the next person (or people) on the WL will automatically be moved to the Yes RSVP list.

Guests: Welcome, up to 3 per person.

Fees/Costs: None, unless we go out for a bite to eat afterwards.  Please bring cash to pay for your food and beverages if so.  The BCYC offers drinks for sale for $1 each which goes towards the BCYC.  You are welcome to bring your dinner with you.

RSVP Deadline: Wednesday @ 2pm

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


Directions to the Braintree Community Youth Center (BCYC) located @ 74 Pond Street, Braintree, MA:

Overview: The BCYC is located on Pond Street, approximately 1 mile from Braintree High School and the T and highway. It is one of two brick buildings next to a cemetary across from Sunset Lake.


From Routes 24/95/128/93:
Head towards Route 3 South/Braintree/Cape Cod.

From Route 3: Take Exit 17/Union Street, Braintree.  Exit the Rotary heading towards the T and South Braintree.  Go straight through the 1st light keeping the T on your left.  Go up the hill and take a left at the next light onto Washington Street.  Follow straight thru 2 sets of lights passing Town Hall on your right.  At the next set of lights take a right, which is still Washington Street.  (Rite-Aid is at this intersection.  It will be to your left at the light and behind you after you make the turn.)  Take a left at the next light (onto Route 37S) keeping Braintree Cooperative Bank on your left.  Take a right at the next light onto Pond Street.  74 Pond Street is 1/4 mile up on the left next to a cemetery.  It is one of two brick buildings.  Park on the side.


From the Braintree T: Follow directions above on foot.
item.how_to_find_us: We meet in the BCYC located on the 2nd floor.

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: Habitat for Humanity Braintree Area LPC Monthly Community Meeting!
